body:
Thanks for reporting, unfortunately there is nothing we can do here... 

This sounds like a Jacoco bug TBH

Hi @geoand ,

Thanks for your feedback. I also see that this is not a Quarkus problem. However, there is probably nothing Jacoco can do about it either, e.g. https://github.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/1653. 

There is also a bug report in the AWS SDK https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-java-v2/issues/6234.
The workaround is usually to exclude the class from Jacoco by configuration

However, this is currently not possible in the JacocoProcessor.
https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/0404a0c41f14a05abf3ce82d99459f8cc827717f/test-framework/jacoco/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/jacoco/deployment/JacocoProcessor.java#L80

 I could possibly make a CR to use the `excludes` config if it would be ok.

I have a few questions here:
- should we catch a `ClassTooLargeException` and just not instrument the class in this case? And log a warning.
- I'm surprised we instrument all the classes of all the libraries. I would have expected we would measure the coverage of only the application classes? But I'm probably missing something?

BTW, these questions don't prevent us from adding a way to ignore a class (or maybe even an entire archive).

> I'm surprised we instrument all the classes of all the libraries. I would have expected we would measure the coverage of only the application classes? But I'm probably missing something?

@geoand I would be interested in your feedback on this question.
That's probably what we should be doing
@dagrammy are you able to test a PR and see if the test coverage is still fine?
Reopening as I think there is more to it.

issue.title: Jacoco - Only instrument workspace classes
issue.body:
Also avoid failing the building if we can't instrument a class, which can happen if the class is so large than adding the instrumentation causes the class to reach the limits.

- Fixes: #49238

body:
@dagrammy I would appreciate if you could test https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/49304, especially if you have a multi-module project.
You should check two things: that it works and that the test coverage is the same.

@gsmet Many thanks for your time and effort.

I'm going on vacation in a few days, but I'll try to test and check the change before then.

EDIT:
On the first try we have a drop from about 85% to 63%. It seems that especially 2 submodules are affected.
